channel.title: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites
channel.description: Hello I'm working on making a 2D runescape based game sorta like how minicraft is to minecraft but instead like miniscape or something. I'm not the best at making sprites, and i really need some good quality sprites. I'm looking for someone who i can give a design of a npc or background or anything and they can make a 2D pixelated version.

item.title: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites
item.dc:creator: @JoshuaCoombs JoshuaCoombs
item.description:
@JoshuaCoombs wrote:

[quote=“artem543, post:14, topic:536599”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=655412.msg4389476#msg4389476 date=1386976411]

Look into spine. You could create really high detail animations using snapshots of your models without requiring any drawing or artist. That plus some sort of isometric perspective of your 3D art would be enough to do basically all of the in-game art.

OMFG, I just saw Thronefall. Omg, I am soooo impressed. Have no words. In my opinion, there is just a lack of sprites. Otherwise that was soo amazing. Runescape going down. Hehe
Ooo thank you I just looked up spine i think it will help a lot. Of course gots to pay for it ;] but if i just use snap shots then maybe i can just use the trial version? not sure but do you know of any free software like spine? and also you think the whole snap shots of 3D models instead of drawing pixels out is a good idea?

Well with limited resources, it’s really effective. I don’t know any freeware version of spine, in fact spine is pretty exclusive by itself. I know of games that use similar technology, but that’s going to be proprietary. I would love to write something like spine myself, but I doubt I’d have time for that. Tis a shame.

We don’t want to keep Taharok from working on Thornefall, now, do we?
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites

item.source: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites

item.title: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“artem543, post:8, topic:536599”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=655412.msg4388076#msg4388076 date=1386447825]

I’m sure you’ll find plenty of professional artists willing to work on exactly what you want for free. I’m pretty sure they don’t have anything better to do with their time.

If you’re seriously expecting to create a game, I’d recommend finding free graphic resources for your game and paying someone to produce something better if you’ve made some progress and couldn’t find what you were looking for. You could also using sprites from existing games for prototyping, but keep in mind you wouldn’t be able to release it.

http://opengameart.org/art-search-advanced?keys=&field_art_type_tid[]=9

thanks for the link, but yea i want to make my own sprites though so that im not copying other peoples work ya know? do you know anyone who might be willing to help me?
[/quote]

Just wondering, what is that membertitle you have?[/quote]

MoparScape Modeling Contest Winner 3D modeling section I won last year.

And actually ive been thinking up a new way to do this, i’m going to take 3d models because thats what im good at and separate each piece of the character as in arms, legs, head etc. and im going to screen shot them from the angle i need and move them accordingly to what i want and make different frames for the animations of characters. then for the background i’ll probably do the same thing a 3D background but its a picture rather then actually being there? whats yalls thoughts and opinions of this?

Read full topic

If you’re seriously expecting to create a game, I’d recommend finding free graphic resources for your game and paying someone to produce something better if you’ve made some progress and couldn’t find what you were looking for. You could also using sprites from existing games for prototyping, but keep in mind you wouldn’t be able to release it.

[/quote]

Just wondering, what is that membertitle you have?

item.title: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:4, topic:536599”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=655412.msg4388050#msg4388050 date=1386439287]
I’m sure you’ll find plenty of professional artists willing to work on exactly what you want for free. I’m pretty sure they don’t have anything better to do with their time.

If you’re seriously expecting to create a game, I’d recommend finding free graphic resources for your game and paying someone to produce something better if you’ve made some progress and couldn’t find what you were looking for. You could also using sprites from existing games for prototyping, but keep in mind you wouldn’t be able to release it.

http://opengameart.org/art-search-advanced?keys=&field_art_type_tid[]=9

[/quote]

thanks for the link, but yea i want to make my own sprites though so that im not copying other peoples work ya know? do you know anyone who might be willing to help me?[/quote]The link I gave you has a large amount of free game sprites. The arists have put up their work under free licenses, allowing people to use them without paying them or infrigning copyrights. It’s going to be rather difficult to find talented artists willing to make specific sprites for your game when aren’t going to pay them.

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Game Project Need Someone good at making Sprites
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:5, topic:536599”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=655412.msg4388076#msg4388076 date=1386447825]

I’m sure you’ll find plenty of professional artists willing to work on exactly what you want for free. I’m pretty sure they don’t have anything better to do with their time.

If you’re seriously expecting to create a game, I’d recommend finding free graphic resources for your game and paying someone to produce something better if you’ve made some progress and couldn’t find what you were looking for. You could also using sprites from existing games for prototyping, but keep in mind you wouldn’t be able to release it.

http://opengameart.org/art-search-advanced?keys=&field_art_type_tid[]=9

thanks for the link, but yea i want to make my own sprites though so that im not copying other peoples work ya know? do you know anyone who might be willing to help me?
[/quote]as he said, you should steal some sprites to use as placeholders. then when you have a decent game you’re more likely to find people who will be inspired to draw art for it.[/quote]

oh okay i see what your saying thanks thats a good plan

Read full topic
